<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Market-Forecast">Market Forecast<a class="anchor-link" href="#Market-Forecast">¶</a></h2><p>What should we project for the U.S stocks in 2018, or maybe in 3 years' period? Although Keynes once said that in long-term run every one would die, but we just need to shorten this infinite long term to a certain T, ie, 3 to 5 years.</p>
<p>We have seem the upward trend for most of the stock market from late 2016 to present. And U.S stocks are showing as well a peaking momentum.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>dplyr<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>quantmod<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>dygraphs<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>WindR<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>IRdisplay<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>ggplot2<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>htmlwidgets<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>ticker <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"XLY"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"XLP"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"XLE"</span><span class="p">,</span>    <span class="s">"XLF"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"XLV"</span><span class="p">,</span>   
            <span class="s">"XLI"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"XLB"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"XLK"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"XLU"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"SPY"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="c1"># And the accompanying sector names for those ETFs.</span>

sector <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Consumer Discretionary"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Consumer Staples"</span><span class="p">,</span> 
            <span class="s">"Energy"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Financials"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Health Care"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Industrials"</span><span class="p">,</span> 
            <span class="s">"Materials"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Information Technology"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Utilities"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Index"</span><span class="p">)</span>

etf_ticker_sector <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">data_frame</span><span class="p">(</span>ticker<span class="p">,</span> sector<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># A function to build an xts object of etf returns.</span>

etf_weekly_returns <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kr">function</span><span class="p">(</span>ticker<span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span>
    
symbols <span class="o"><-</span> getSymbols<span class="p">(</span>ticker<span class="p">,</span> auto.assign <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">TRUE</span><span class="p">,</span> warnings <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">FALSE</span><span class="p">)</span>

etf_prices <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">do.call</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">merge</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="kp">lapply</span><span class="p">(</span>symbols<span class="p">,</span> <span class="kr">function</span><span class="p">(</span>x<span class="p">)</span> Cl<span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">get</span><span class="p">(</span>x<span class="p">))))</span>
    
etf_returns <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">do.call</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">merge</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="kp">lapply</span><span class="p">(</span>etf_prices<span class="p">,</span> 
                                     <span class="kr">function</span><span class="p">(</span>x<span class="p">)</span> periodReturn<span class="p">(</span>x<span class="p">,</span> period <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">'weekly'</span><span class="p">,</span> type <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">'log'</span><span class="p">)))</span>

<span class="c1">#Change the column names to the sector names from our dataframe above.</span>

<span class="kp">colnames</span><span class="p">(</span>etf_returns<span class="p">)</span> <span class="o"><-</span> etf_ticker_sector<span class="o">$</span>sector
    
etf_returns

<span class="p">}</span>
etf_returns <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">suppressWarnings</span><span class="p">(</span>etf_weekly_returns<span class="p">(</span>etf_ticker_sector<span class="o">$</span>ticker<span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stderr output_text">
<pre>pausing 1 second between requests for more than 5 symbols
pausing 1 second between requests for more than 5 symbols
pausing 1 second between requests for more than 5 symbols
pausing 1 second between requests for more than 5 symbols
pausing 1 second between requests for more than 5 symbols
pausing 1 second between requests for more than 5 symbols
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>cum_etf_re <span class="o"><-</span> etf_returns<span class="p">[</span><span class="s">"2017-01-01/"</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="kr">for</span> <span class="p">(</span>i <span class="kr">in</span> <span class="m">1</span><span class="o">:</span><span class="kp">ncol</span><span class="p">(</span>cum_etf_re<span class="p">)){</span>
  <span class="kr">for</span> <span class="p">(</span>m <span class="kr">in</span> <span class="m">1</span><span class="o">:</span><span class="kp">nrow</span><span class="p">(</span>cum_etf_re<span class="p">)){</span>
    cum_etf_re<span class="p">[</span>m<span class="p">,</span>i<span class="p">]</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">prod</span><span class="p">(</span>etf_returns<span class="p">[</span><span class="s">"2017-01-01/"</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="o">:</span>m<span class="p">,</span>i<span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="m">1</span> <span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="m">1</span>
  <span class="p">}</span>
<span class="p">}</span>
dy <span class="o"><-</span> dygraph<span class="p">(</span>cum_etf_re<span class="p">,</span> main <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"Return rate of SP500 and others"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">%>%</span> 
    dyAxis<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"y"</span><span class="p">,</span> label <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"Cum_Return"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">%>%</span> 
    dyRangeSelector<span class="p">(</span>height <span class="o">=</span> <span class="m">20</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">%>%</span>
    dyLegend<span class="p">(</span>width <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"500"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="c1">#htmlwidgets::saveWidget(dy, "m.html")</span>
display_html<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">'<iframe src="m.html" width="100%" height="450"></iframe>'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<iframe height="450" src="m.html" width="100%"></iframe>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The energy panel is of the worst performance, while its investment contribution is the most for the economy growth of the U.S. The reason is that no people have a good prospect for the traditional energy company. Considering that the operating income growth is -6%,-35%,17% in the three consecutive reporting year, the prospect is reasonable. However, this year, why the growth increases to 32% in the first quarter? I believe the big drive is the energy investment on the basis of infrastructure reconstruction since the presidency of Trump.</p>
<p>Another reason is that the oil price is poping since the start of 2017, due to the tense internaional regional uncertainty. The accumulated return rate of oil is nearly 100%, far above any aggregated stock market return rate since 2016. I believe the consistent increment of oil price as well as the uncertainty in the Arabian region would still drive the global oil price to a new peak.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>w.start<span class="p">()</span>
oil_pice_opec <span class="o"><-</span> w.edb<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">'S0031526'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s">'2013-01-01'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s">'2017-12-31'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s">'Fill=Previous'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">$</span>Data
ggplot<span class="p">(</span>data<span class="o">=</span>oil_pice_opec<span class="p">,</span>aes<span class="p">(</span>x<span class="o">=</span>DATETIME<span class="p">,</span>y<span class="o">=</span>CLOSE<span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">+</span> geom_line<span class="p">()</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
  labs<span class="p">(</span>title<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"Daily Oil Price(Opec Basket)"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> 
  theme<span class="p">(</span>plot.title <span class="o">=</span> element_text<span class="p">(</span>hjust <span class="o">=</span> <span class="m">0.5</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The energy sector is fluctuating alawys with the oil price. Next year, the oil price will still recover from the 2014's level, for three reasons:</p>
<p>1) Demand recovers from the economic recover worldwide. Multiple super power, Eurozone, Japan, the U.S and of course China are expecting a more robost growth next year.</p>
<p>2) China's demand for energy leans to natural gas to replace the coal burning, the over-demand of natural gas will drive the global energy giants to deploy the related channel, equipment, and employees investment, which have been seen from third quarter financial report of the energy companies.</p>
<p>3) The political uncertainties in arabia regions as well as the financial stability in terms of the brand-new E-currency still lays out the doubt for the future oil price. Considering the high level of stock price in the States, RMB's out-of-expected going record high in the late December and Trump's new plan on infrastructure and internal trade. I believe investors should consider long oil and gold for commodities and also long for energy sector.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>cum_etf_re <span class="o"><-</span> etf_returns<span class="p">[</span><span class="s">"2014-01-01/2014-12-31"</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="kr">for</span> <span class="p">(</span>i <span class="kr">in</span> <span class="m">1</span><span class="o">:</span><span class="kp">ncol</span><span class="p">(</span>cum_etf_re<span class="p">)){</span>
  <span class="kr">for</span> <span class="p">(</span>m <span class="kr">in</span> <span class="m">1</span><span class="o">:</span><span class="kp">nrow</span><span class="p">(</span>cum_etf_re<span class="p">)){</span>
    cum_etf_re<span class="p">[</span>m<span class="p">,</span>i<span class="p">]</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">prod</span><span class="p">(</span>etf_returns<span class="p">[</span><span class="s">"2014-01-01/2014-12-31"</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="o">:</span>m<span class="p">,</span>i<span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="m">1</span> <span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="m">1</span>
  <span class="p">}</span>
<span class="p">}</span>
dy1<span class="o"><-</span>dygraph<span class="p">(</span>cum_etf_re<span class="o">$</span><span class="s">"Energy"</span><span class="p">,</span> main <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"Return rate of energy sector"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">%>%</span> 
    dyAxis<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"y"</span><span class="p">,</span> label <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"Cum_Return"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">%>%</span> 
    dyRangeSelector<span class="p">(</span>height <span class="o">=</span> <span class="m">20</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">%>%</span>
    dyLegend<span class="p">(</span>width <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"500"</span><span class="p">)</span>
htmlwidgets<span class="o">::</span>saveWidget<span class="p">(</span>dy1<span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"m1.html"</span><span class="p">)</span>
display_html<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">'<iframe src="m1.html" width="100%" height="450"></iframe>'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<iframe height="450" src="m1.html" width="100%"></iframe>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># A function that calculates the rolling correlation between a sector ETF and the SPY SP500 ETF. </span>

sector_index_correlation <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kr">function</span><span class="p">(</span>x<span class="p">,</span> window<span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span>
  
    merged_xts <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">merge</span><span class="p">(</span>x<span class="p">,</span> etf_returns<span class="o">$</span><span class="s">'Index'</span><span class="p">)</span>

    merged_xts<span class="o">$</span>rolling_test <span class="o"><-</span> rollapply<span class="p">(</span>merged_xts<span class="p">,</span> window<span class="p">,</span> 
                                         <span class="kr">function</span><span class="p">(</span>x<span class="p">)</span> cor<span class="p">(</span>x<span class="p">[,</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">],</span> x<span class="p">[,</span><span class="m">2</span><span class="p">],</span> use <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"pairwise.complete.obs"</span><span class="p">),</span> 
                                         by.column <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">FALSE</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="kp">names</span><span class="p">(</span>merged_xts<span class="p">)</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"Sector Returns"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"SPY Returns"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"Sector/SPY Correlation"</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    merged_xts
<span class="p">}</span>

<span class="c1"># Choose a sector ETF and a rolling window and pass them to the function we just build. </span>
<span class="c1"># Let's go with a 5 month window and the Information Technology sector.</span>
<span class="c1"># We will now have a new xts object with 3 time series: sector returns, SPY returns</span>
<span class="c1"># and the rolling correlation between those return series.</span>

IT_SPY_correlation <span class="o"><-</span> sector_index_correlation<span class="p">(</span>etf_returns<span class="o">$</span><span class="s">'Information Technology'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="m">20</span><span class="p">)</span>
Energy_SPY_correlation <span class="o"><-</span> sector_index_correlation<span class="p">(</span>etf_returns<span class="o">$</span><span class="s">'Energy'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="m">20</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="c1"># matrix for all cor</span>
cor <span class="o"><-</span> etf_returns<span class="p">[,</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="kr">for</span> <span class="p">(</span>i <span class="kr">in</span> <span class="m">1</span><span class="o">:</span><span class="kp">ncol</span><span class="p">(</span>etf_returns<span class="p">)){</span>
  cor <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">merge</span><span class="p">(</span>cor<span class="p">,</span>sector_index_correlation<span class="p">(</span>etf_returns<span class="p">[,</span>i<span class="p">],</span> <span class="m">20</span><span class="p">)[,</span><span class="m">3</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="p">}</span>
cor <span class="o"><-</span> cor<span class="p">[,</span><span class="m">-1</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="c1"># to examine the col of cor</span>
<span class="kp">ncol</span><span class="p">(</span>cor<span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="kp">ncol</span><span class="p">(</span>etf_returns<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">colnames</span><span class="p">(</span>cor<span class="p">)</span> <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">colnames</span><span class="p">(</span>etf_returns<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
TRUE
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>dy2 <span class="o"><-</span> dygraph<span class="p">(</span>cor<span class="p">[,</span><span class="m">-10</span><span class="p">],</span> main <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"Correlation between SP500 and others"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">%>%</span> 
    dyAxis<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"y"</span><span class="p">,</span> label <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"Correlation"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">%>%</span> 
    dyRangeSelector<span class="p">(</span>height <span class="o">=</span> <span class="m">20</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">%>%</span>
    dyShading<span class="p">(</span>from <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"2007-12-01"</span><span class="p">,</span> to <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"2009-06-01"</span><span class="p">,</span> color <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"#FFE6E6"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">%>%</span> 
    dyEvent<span class="p">(</span>x <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"2008-09-15"</span><span class="p">,</span> label <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"Fin Crisis"</span><span class="p">,</span> labelLoc <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"top"</span><span class="p">,</span> color <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"red"</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">%>%</span>
    dyLegend<span class="p">(</span>width <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s">"500"</span><span class="p">)</span>
saveWidget<span class="p">(</span>dy2<span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"m2.html"</span><span class="p">)</span>
display_html<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">'<iframe src="m2.html" width="100%" height="450"></iframe>'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea ">
<iframe height="450" src="m2.html" width="100%"></iframe>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From the graph, we could certainly know what really drives the U.S stock going up in the latest years, the technology and the infrastructure recovery. And what should impress the investors is the uncorrelation with S&P; dex of energy, utilities, materials and health care. Those four industries support the most basic demand of people: transpotation, heating,eletricity and water, living and government-driven construction and consumption on health care.In the economy falling down period, the consumption desire of income would be ocntracted. However, in the recovery time, which is right at the time for now, the investors should weight on the industrial, energy and technology.That is my suggestion regarding next year's U.S stock investment.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>

    mathjaxscript.src = '//cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/mathjax/2.7.1/MathJax.js?config=TeX-AMS-MML_HTMLorMML';
    mathjaxscript[(window.opera ? "innerHTML" : "text")] =
        "MathJax.Hub.Config({" +
        "    config: ['MMLorHTML.js']," +
        "    TeX: { extensions: ['AMSmath.js','AMSsymbols.js','noErrors.js','noUndefined.js'], equationNumbers: { autoNumber: 'AMS' } }," +
        "    jax: ['input/TeX','input/MathML','output/HTML-CSS']," +
        "    extensions: ['tex2jax.js','mml2jax.js','MathMenu.js','MathZoom.js']," +
        "    displayAlign: 'center'," +
        "    displayIndent: '0em'," +
        "    showMathMenu: true," +
        "    tex2jax: { " +
        "        inlineMath: [ ['$','$'] ], " +
        "        displayMath: [ ['$$','$$'] ]," +
        "        processEscapes: true," +
        "        preview: 'TeX'," +
        "    }, " +
        "    'HTML-CSS': { " +
        " linebreaks: { automatic: true, width: '95% container' }, " +
        "        styles: { '.MathJax_Display, .MathJax .mo, .MathJax .mi, .MathJax .mn': {color: 'black ! important'} }" +
        "    } " +
        "}); ";
    (document.body || document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0]).appendChild(mathjaxscript);
}
</script>

entry.title: MPK and Growth
entry.content:
Economists have long discussed the role of investment as a drive for the economic growth around the globe, by distinguishing the investment category. Romer(1986,1987,19980) , Lucas(1988) stresses the importance of investment in R&D;, in human capital and fixed capital, while De Long and Summers(1991,1992,1993) discuss about the social return to investment in machinery and equipment.

Upon the economy growth downturn of China in terms of the influence of the physical capital, many scholars have demonstrated their viewpoints based on the marginal product of capital along the years, among which the standpoints of Wang (2015) and Yao (2015) are of the most representative yet the most incongruent. Wang (2015) attributed the economy slow-down to the structured imbalance between the investment and consumption need, while Yao(2015) argued that the both investment rate or marginal capital product are pro-cyclical relative to the economic growth. In this paper, I would like to advance the argument into two solid questions: 1) Is Chinese investment return pro-cyclical or counter-cyclical; 2) Does it exist the overindulged investment relative to the consumption that leads to the economic slow-down, based on a more comprehensive framework of the development economy model.

entry.title: A basketball theory test
entry.summary: Can 33.3% three point beat 50% 2 point?¶

  vertical-align: baseline;

  border-radius: 0;

/* This class is for the output subarea inside the output_area and after
   the prompt div. */
div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: auto;
  padding: 0.4em;
  /* Old browsers */
  -webkit-box-flex: 1;
  -moz-box-flex: 1;
  box-flex: 1;
  /* Modern browsers */
  flex: 1;
  max-width: calc(100% - 14ex);
}
div.output_scroll div.output_subarea {
  overflow-x: visible;
}
/* The rest of the output_* classes are for special styling of the different
   output types */
/* all text output has this class: */
div.output_text {
  text-align: left;
  color: #000;
  /* This has to match that of the the CodeMirror class line-height below */
  line-height: 1.21429em;
}
/* stdout/stderr are 'text' as well as 'stream', but execute_result/error are *not* streams */
div.output_stderr {
  background: #fdd;
  /* very light red background for stderr */
}
div.output_latex {
  text-align: left;
}
/* Empty output_javascript divs should have no height */
div.output_javascript:empty {
  padding: 0;
}
.js-error {
  color: darkred;
}
/* raw_input styles */
div.raw_input_container {
  line-height: 1.21429em;
  padding-top: 5px;
}
pre.raw_input_prompt {
  /* nothing needed here. */
}
input.raw_input {
  font-family: monospace;
  font-size: inherit;
  color: inherit;
  width: auto;
  /* make sure input baseline aligns with prompt */
  vertical-align: baseline;
  /* padding + margin = 0.5em between prompt and cursor */
  padding: 0em 0.25em;
  margin: 0em 0.25em;
}
input.raw_input:focus {
  box-shadow: none;
}
p.p-space {
  margin-bottom: 10px;
}
div.output_unrecognized {
  padding: 5px;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: red;
}
div.output_unrecognized a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
div.output_unrecognized a:hover {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: none;
}
.rendered_html {
  color: #000;
  /* any extras will just be numbers: */
}



.rendered_html :link {
  text-decoration: underline;
}

  text-decoration: underline;
}

  margin-top: 0.538em;
}

}

}

}
.rendered_html img,

.rendered_html img.unconfined,

div.text_cell {

  outline: none;

<h1 id="Can-33.3%-three-point-beat-50%-2-point?">Can 33.3% three point beat 50% 2 point?<a class="anchor-link" href="#Can-33.3%-three-point-beat-50%-2-point?">¶</a></h1>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>rvest<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>RJSONIO<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>RCurl<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>stringr<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>XML<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kn">library</span><span class="p">(</span>ggplot2<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">Sys.setlocale</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"LC_ALL"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s">"ENGLISH"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [40]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># test   </span>
dta <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">character</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kr">for</span> <span class="p">(</span>i <span class="kr">in</span> <span class="m">0</span><span class="o">:</span><span class="m">33</span><span class="p">){</span>
  url <span class="o"><-</span> str_c<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"http://www.stat-nba.com/query.php?page="</span><span class="p">,</span>i<span class="p">,</span><span class="s">"&QueryType;=game&Player;_id=526&crtcol;=seasonℴ=1#label_show_result"</span><span class="p">)</span>
  html <span class="o"><-</span> getURL<span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">url</span><span class="p">)</span>
  content_harden <span class="o"><-</span> htmlParse<span class="p">(</span>html<span class="p">)</span>
  dta_harden <span class="o"><-</span> xpathSApply<span class="p">(</span>content_harden<span class="p">,</span><span class="s">"//tbody//tr//td"</span><span class="p">,</span>xmlValue<span class="p">)</span>
  dta_i <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">gsub</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"%"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s">""</span><span class="p">,</span>dta_harden<span class="p">)</span>
  dta <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span>dta<span class="p">,</span>dta_i<span class="p">)</span>
  <span class="c1">#dta_i <- matrix(as.numeric(dta_i),20,length(dta_harden)/20,byrow = TRUE)</span>
  <span class="c1">#dta <- rbind(dta,dta_i)</span>
<span class="p">}</span>
ind <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">gsub</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"normal"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s">""</span><span class="p">,</span>xpathSApply<span class="p">(</span>content_harden<span class="p">,</span><span class="s">"//tbody//tr//td"</span><span class="p">,</span>xmlGetAttr<span class="p">,</span><span class="s">"class"</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="o">:</span><span class="m">24</span><span class="p">])</span>
ind <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">gsub</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"change_color.?[[:alnum:]].+"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s">""</span><span class="p">,</span>ind<span class="p">)</span>
ind <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">gsub</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"[[:blank:]]"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s">""</span><span class="p">,</span>ind<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [41]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>dta <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">matrix</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">as.numeric</span><span class="p">(</span>dta<span class="p">),</span><span class="kp">length</span><span class="p">(</span>dta<span class="p">)</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="m">24</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">24</span><span class="p">,</span>byrow <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">TRUE</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">options</span><span class="p">(</span>warn<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">-1</span><span class="p">)</span>
dta<span class="p">[,</span><span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">7</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">13</span><span class="p">)]</span> <span class="o"><-</span> dta<span class="p">[,</span><span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">7</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">13</span><span class="p">)]</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="m">100</span>
<span class="c1">#dta[,c(8,11,14)] <- dta[,c(8,11,14)]*100</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [42]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">colnames</span><span class="p">(</span>dta<span class="p">)</span> <span class="o"><-</span> ind
<span class="c1"># Curry 3 points</span>
<span class="kp">options</span><span class="p">(</span>repr.plot.width<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">6</span><span class="p">,</span> repr.plot.height<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">5</span><span class="p">)</span>
plot<span class="p">(</span>density<span class="p">(</span>dta<span class="p">[,</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">],</span>na.rm <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">T</span><span class="p">,</span>from<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">0</span><span class="p">,</span>to<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">),</span>main<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"Field Goal Density of Stephen Curry"</span><span class="p">)</span>
abline<span class="p">(</span>v<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">mean</span><span class="p">(</span>dta<span class="p">[,</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">],</span>na.rm <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">T</span><span class="p">),</span>col<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"blue"</span><span class="p">)</span>
lines<span class="p">(</span>density<span class="p">(</span>rnorm<span class="p">(</span><span class="m">100000</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="kp">mean</span><span class="p">(</span>dta<span class="p">[,</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">],</span>na.rm <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">T</span><span class="p">),</span>sd<span class="p">(</span>dta<span class="p">[,</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">],</span>na.rm <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">T</span><span class="p">)),</span>from<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">0</span><span class="p">,</span>to<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">),</span>col<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"yellow"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Is-field-goal-persistent-to-the-player's-fatigue?">Is field goal persistent to the player's fatigue?<a class="anchor-link" href="#Is-field-goal-persistent-to-the-player's-fatigue?">¶</a></h1>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [43]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>dta_dtaframe2 <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">as.data.frame</span><span class="p">(</span>dta<span class="p">)</span>
fit <span class="o"><-</span> glm<span class="p">(</span>threepper<span class="o">~</span>mp<span class="o">+</span><span class="kp">I</span><span class="p">(</span>mp<span class="o">^</span><span class="m">2</span><span class="p">),</span>family <span class="o">=</span> gaussian<span class="p">,</span>dta_dtaframe2<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">summary</span><span class="p">(</span>fit<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>From the logistic regression, we find that Stephen Curry has an ability of shooting 3s without inteference of the game period and the body fatigue.</p>

</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>On the other side, let us take a look at James Harden's 3 point shooting for a comparison.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [19]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>dta <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">character</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kr">for</span> <span class="p">(</span>i <span class="kr">in</span> <span class="m">0</span><span class="o">:</span><span class="m">33</span><span class="p">){</span>
  url <span class="o"><-</span> str_c<span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"http://www.stat-nba.com/query.php?page="</span><span class="p">,</span>i<span class="p">,</span><span class="s">"&QueryType;=game&Player;_id=1628&crtcol;=seasonℴ=1#label_show_result"</span><span class="p">)</span>
  html <span class="o"><-</span> getURL<span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">url</span><span class="p">)</span>
  content_harden <span class="o"><-</span> htmlParse<span class="p">(</span>html<span class="p">)</span>
  dta_harden <span class="o"><-</span> xpathSApply<span class="p">(</span>content_harden<span class="p">,</span><span class="s">"//tbody//tr//td"</span><span class="p">,</span>xmlValue<span class="p">)</span>
  dta_i <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">gsub</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s">"%"</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s">""</span><span class="p">,</span>dta_harden<span class="p">)</span>
  dta <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span>dta<span class="p">,</span>dta_i<span class="p">)</span>
  <span class="c1">#dta_i <- matrix(as.numeric(dta_i),20,length(dta_harden)/20,byrow = TRUE)</span>
  <span class="c1">#dta <- rbind(dta,dta_i)</span>
<span class="p">}</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [44]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>dta <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kt">matrix</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="kp">as.numeric</span><span class="p">(</span>dta<span class="p">),</span><span class="kp">length</span><span class="p">(</span>dta<span class="p">)</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="m">24</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">24</span><span class="p">,</span>byrow <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">TRUE</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">options</span><span class="p">(</span>warn<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">-1</span><span class="p">)</span>
dta<span class="p">[,</span><span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">7</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">13</span><span class="p">)]</span> <span class="o"><-</span> dta<span class="p">[,</span><span class="kt">c</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="m">7</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="m">13</span><span class="p">)]</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="m">100</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [33]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span><span class="kp">options</span><span class="p">(</span>repr.plot.width<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">6</span><span class="p">,</span> repr.plot.height<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">5</span><span class="p">)</span>
plot<span class="p">(</span>density<span class="p">(</span>dta<span class="p">[,</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">],</span>na.rm <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">T</span><span class="p">,</span>from<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">0</span><span class="p">,</span>to<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">),</span>main<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"Field Goal Density of James Harden"</span><span class="p">)</span>
abline<span class="p">(</span>v<span class="o">=</span><span class="kp">mean</span><span class="p">(</span>dta<span class="p">[,</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">],</span>na.rm <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">T</span><span class="p">),</span>col<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"blue"</span><span class="p">)</span>
lines<span class="p">(</span>density<span class="p">(</span>rnorm<span class="p">(</span><span class="m">100000</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="kp">mean</span><span class="p">(</span>dta<span class="p">[,</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">],</span>na.rm <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">T</span><span class="p">),</span>sd<span class="p">(</span>dta<span class="p">[,</span><span class="m">10</span><span class="p">],</span>na.rm <span class="o">=</span> <span class="bp">T</span><span class="p">)),</span>from<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">0</span><span class="p">,</span>to<span class="o">=</span><span class="m">1</span><span class="p">),</span>col<span class="o">=</span><span class="s">"yellow"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>James Harden's 3 point shooting is very interesting though as his peak value is left skewed against its mean value, which means he has lots of time being unstable on shooting 3s. Let's see how fatigue has contributed to this.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-r"><pre><span></span>dta_dtaframe <span class="o"><-</span> <span class="kp">as.data.frame</span><span class="p">(</span>dta<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">colnames</span><span class="p">(</span>dta_dtaframe<span class="p">)</span> <span class="o"><-</span> ind
fit <span class="o"><-</span> glm<span class="p">(</span>threepper<span class="o">~</span>mp<span class="o">+</span><span class="kp">I</span><span class="p">(</span>mp<span class="o">^</span><span class="m">2</span><span class="p">),</span>family <span class="o">=</span> gaussian<span class="p">,</span>dta_dtaframe<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="kp">summary</span><span class="p">(</span>fit<span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea ">
<pre>
Call:
glm(formula = threepper ~ mp + I(mp^2), family = gaussian, data = dta_dtaframe)

Deviance Residuals: 
    Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max  
-0.3758  -0.1493  -0.0109   0.1287   0.7153  

Coefficients:
              Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)  
(Intercept) -0.0033607  0.1412985  -0.024   0.9810  
mp           0.0227388  0.0088643   2.565   0.0105 *
I(mp^2)     -0.0003409  0.0001365  -2.498   0.0127 *
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

(Dispersion parameter for gaussian family taken to be 0.04653779)

    Null deviance: 31.723  on 677  degrees of freedom
Residual deviance: 31.413  on 675  degrees of freedom
  (2 observations deleted due to missingness)
AIC: -150.68

Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 2
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Remark">Remark<a class="anchor-link" href="#Remark">¶</a></h2><p>We could see that James Harden's 3 point shooting is heavily influenced by the game period, when James plays more than 30 minutes, every one more minutes he plays, his three point shooting is decreasing at rate of 0.03%, which is a large influence for a top player worldwide, which would be larger in the play-offs if we consider the more intense physical contact.</p>
<p>In summary, I really doubt the theory that 33.3% 3 point could beat 50% 2 point in the basketball field, as the shooting percentage is biasedly skewed along with the body fatigue, especially for some players.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
